intro: Govenia powellii, commonly known as the Powell's govenia, is a flowering plant species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of pink or white blooms. Govenia powellii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to adapt to arid environments.
